intro: Euphrasia hirtella var. ramosa, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in rich, loamy soils. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are covered in fine, hairy textures. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar structural and ecological traits. Euphrasia hirtella var. ramosa is often found in association with other woodland flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
